Text: An oracle is within my heart concerning the sinfulness of the wicked: There is no fear of God before his eyes.
Context: The psalm begins with an introspective oracle concerning the sinful state of the wicked, noting their lack of reverence towards God.

Text: For in his own eyes he flatters himself too much to detect or hate his sin.
Context: The wicked person is self-deceived, unable to see or detest his own sinful state.

Text: The words of his mouth are wicked and deceitful; he has ceased to be wise and to do good.
Context: This verse describes the actions and speech of the wicked, highlighting their departure from wisdom and goodness.

Text: Even on his bed he plots evil; he commits himself to a sinful course and does not reject what is wrong.
Context: The intensification of wickedness is evident as the individual not only contemplates but also commits to evil actions.

Text: Your loving devotion, O LORD, reaches to the heavens, your faithfulness to the skies.
Context: The focus shifts to extolling the boundless love and faithfulness of the LORD, drawing a stark contrast with the previous verses about wickedness.

Text: Your righteousness is like the mightiest mountains, Your judgments are like the great deep. O LORD, You preserve man and beast.
Context: The psalmist praises God’s righteousness and judgments, using grand natural imagery to convey the magnitude of God‘s care for all creation.

Text: How precious is Your loving devotion, O God, that the children of men take refuge in the shadow of Your wings.
Context: This verse expresses gratitude for God’s love and protection, which provides a safe haven for humanity.

Text: They feast on the abundance of Your house; You give them drink from Your river of delights.
Context: God‘s generosity is highlighted, showing how He provides abundantly for those who depend on Him.

Text: For with You is the fountain of life; in Your light we see light.
Context: It speaks to the life-giving and enlightening nature of God, affirming that He is the source of all life and understanding.

Text: Continue Your loving devotion to those who know You, and Your righteousness to the upright in heart.
Context: The psalmist requests God to maintain His steadfast love and righteousness to those who are faithful and have integrity.

Text: Let not the foot of pride come against me, nor the hand of the wicked drive me away.
Context: The psalmist asks for protection against pride and the influence of the wicked.

Text: See how the evildoers lie fallen—thrown down, not able to rise!
Context: The psalm ends with an observation of the downfall of the wicked, who are unable to recover from their fall.
